FIND OUT MORE











READY FOR
SOMETHING
DIFFERENT?
Experience our deliberately different approach at our next Open Days.
 
BOOK OPEN DAY






EXPLOREOUR COURSES


VIEW ALL






World of Sport


INSPIRE A PASSION FOR SPORT, MOVEMENT AND EXERCISE TO IMPROVE HEALTH AND PERFORMANCE.
Benefit from our strong links with industry partners; Manchester United, Salford City FC and Lancashire Cricket, giving you direct access to real-world experiences and opportunities to learn.
VIEW





World of Media


THE DIFFERENT FORMS OF MEDIA HAVE THE POWER TO INFLUENCE HOW WE THINK, SHAPE OUR RELATIONSHIPS AND MAKE SENSE OF EVERYDAY EVENTS AND EXPERIENCES.
You will learn about the production, consumption and effects of contemporary media and master current digital technologies to create engaging media content in Journalism, Sports Journalism, Media and Communications or Sports Media and Communications.
VIEW





World of Digital


THE DIGITAL TECH INDUSTRY IN THE UK HAS SEEN EXPONENTIAL GROWTH OVER THE LAST DECADE, AND THERE ARE NO SIGNS OF IT SLOWING DOWN.
Digital graduates are in high demand, and our courses provide a gateway into many career options. Co-developed with Microsoft and other industry partners, our digital degrees offer a big emphasis on software development and computer programming.
VIEW





World of Business


STUDY A BUSINESS-RELATED COURSE AT UA92 AND DEVELOP THE CORE SKILLS TO BECOME AN EFFECTIVE FUTURE BUSINESS LEADER.
With input from world-leading organisations like KPMG, TalkTalk and CIMA, you’ll benefit from unique workplace experiences such as insight days, masterclasses and guest lectures. What’s more, the network you create will be infinitely valuable to your future career aspirations.
VIEW








Make it for real
There are more hidden costs to higher education than often realised. Our Make it for Real package ensures you have all the essentials you need for successful study, providing you with a Microsoft Surface device, unlimited data, free travel, lunch every day and a home voucher as part of a support package worth £5,000*.
Make It For Real





OUR PIONEERING
CO-FOUNDERS
Founded by the Class of 92 and Lancaster University, UA92 gives you more than a degree.
We put Character and Personal Development at the core of your learning. Our unique ’92 Programme’ puts a strong emphasis on building skills that employers want and aims to prepare you for life beyond UA92.
 
92 Programme

Home / Study With Us / Apply




APPLY
          NOW        

APPLYING FOR HIGHER EDUCATION CAN BE DAUNTING, BUT WE’RE HERE TO HELP.
AT UA92, YOU CAN BEGIN YOUR STUDIES IN SEPTEMBER, NOVEMBER, JANUARY, FEBRUARY, APRIL OR JUNE.







HOW DO I APPLY?


Want to apply to join UA92? The admissions process can be confusing so we are here to support you. 

If you have any questions about your application, get in touch. We are always happy to help!







MULTIPLE START DATES
At UA92, we have multiple start dates throughout the year. You can start your studies in September, November, January, February, April or June*.
Our next intake date is April 2025!
*Start dates for our different types of courses may vary. See our courses for the most up to date information on start dates.
Contact Us





APPLY TO START IN 2025/26
If you missed the equal consideration deadline on 29 January 2025, you can still apply! Simply follow our step-by-step guide below on how to create your UCAS account and the information you’ll need.
If you have applied to 5 universities and you’re not holding any offers, you can add another choice through UCAS Extra.
Find out more


APPLY TO START BEFORE SEPTEMBER 2025
It’s not too late! You can still start your studies before the next academic year. We have 6 start dates throughout the year; September, November, January, February, April and June.
Contact our Student Recruitment team to discuss the best way to apply.
Contact Student Recruitment





START YOUR JOURNEY AT UA92

YOU CAN EITHER FILL IN THE FORM OR GET IN TOUCH WITH US DIRECTLY BELOW.
E: [email protected]
T: +44 (0)161 507 1999








STEP 1



REGISTER WITH UCAS
GO TO UCAS HUB TO REGISTER. YOU’LL BE TAKEN TO THE UCAS HUB DASHBOARD WHERE YOU’LL FIND THE ‘YOUR APPLICATION’ SECTION.









STEP 2



ADD PERSONAL DETAILS, EDUCATION AND EMPLOYMENT
MAKE SURE YOU COMPLETE ALL MANDATORY QUESTIONS AND YOUR NAME MATCHES THE NAME ON YOUR OFFICIAL DOCUMENTATION I.E. PASSPORT, DRIVING LICENCE ETC. ADD YOUR QUALIFICATIONS FROM SECONDARY EDUCATION ONWARDS AND ANY PAID EMPLOYMENT WHETHER IT WAS FULL OR PART-TIME.









STEP 3



SELECT COURSES
ADD UP TO 5 COURSES IN ANY ORDER, IT DOESN’T MATTER AT THIS POINT WHICH YOU SELECT FIRST. UA92 INSTITUTION CODE IS U01.











STEP 4



WRITE PERSONAL STATEMENT & GET A REFERENCE
WRITE ABOUT YOUR MOTIVATION FOR APPLYING, YOUR REASONS FOR CHOOSING THE COURSE, YOUR TRANSFERRABLE SKILLS, ACADEMIC ACCOMPLISHMENTS AND PERSONAL ACHIEVEMENTS. THEN YOU WILL NEED TO PROVIDE A WRITTEN REFERENCE FROM A TEACHER, ADVISOR OR PROFESSIONAL THAT’S FAMILIAR WITH YOUR ACADEMIC ABILITY.









STEP 5



SUBMIT
CONGRATS YOU’RE READY TO GO! BEFORE YOU SUBMIT YOUR FINAL APPLICATION MAKE SURE YOU CHECK ALL THE DETAILS AND PROOFREAD YOUR PERSONAL STATEMENT.






Aged 19+ and
Returning to
Education?
You don’t always need traditional qualifications to study one of our courses. Our students come from all walks of life.
Find out how to make your dream of returning to education  a reality with our free 2-week programme – FAST FORWARD.
Fast Forward

THE DIFFERENT FORMS OF MEDIA HAVE THE POWER TO INFLUENCE HOW WE THINK, SHAPE OUR RELATIONSHIPS AND MAKE SENSE OF EVERYDAY EVENTS AND EXPERIENCES.
You will learn about the production, consumption and effects of contemporary media and master current digital technologies to create engaging media content in Journalism, Sports Journalism, Media and Communications or Sports Media and Communications.
VIEW





World of Digital


THE DIGITAL TECH INDUSTRY IN THE UK HAS SEEN EXPONENTIAL GROWTH OVER THE LAST DECADE, AND THERE ARE NO SIGNS OF IT SLOWING DOWN.
Digital graduates are in high demand, and our courses provide a gateway into many career options. Co-developed with Microsoft and other industry partners, our digital degrees offer a big emphasis on software development and computer programming.
VIEW





World of Business


STUDY A BUSINESS-RELATED COURSE AT UA92 AND DEVELOP THE CORE SKILLS TO BECOME AN EFFECTIVE FUTURE BUSINESS LEADER.
With input from world-leading organisations like KPMG, TalkTalk and CIMA, you’ll benefit from unique workplace experiences such as insight days, masterclasses and guest lectures. What’s more, the network you create will be infinitely valuable to your future career aspirations.
VIEW

VIEW ALL






World of Sport


INSPIRE A PASSION FOR SPORT, MOVEMENT AND EXERCISE TO IMPROVE HEALTH AND PERFORMANCE.
Benefit from our strong links with industry partners; Manchester United, Salford City FC and Lancashire Cricket, giving you direct access to real-world experiences and opportunities to learn.
VIEW





World of Media


THE DIFFERENT FORMS OF MEDIA HAVE THE POWER TO INFLUENCE HOW WE THINK, SHAPE OUR RELATIONSHIPS AND MAKE SENSE OF EVERYDAY EVENTS AND EXPERIENCES.
You will learn about the production, consumption and effects of contemporary media and master current digital technologies to create engaging media content in Journalism, Sports Journalism, Media and Communications or Sports Media and Communications.
VIEW





World of Digital


THE DIGITAL TECH INDUSTRY IN THE UK HAS SEEN EXPONENTIAL GROWTH OVER THE LAST DECADE, AND THERE ARE NO SIGNS OF IT SLOWING DOWN.
Digital graduates are in high demand, and our courses provide a gateway into many career options. Co-developed with Microsoft and other industry partners, our digital degrees offer a big emphasis on software development and computer programming.
VIEW





World of Business


STUDY A BUSINESS-RELATED COURSE AT UA92 AND DEVELOP THE CORE SKILLS TO BECOME AN EFFECTIVE FUTURE BUSINESS LEADER.
With input from world-leading organisations like KPMG, TalkTalk and CIMA, you’ll benefit from unique workplace experiences such as insight days, masterclasses and guest lectures. What’s more, the network you create will be infinitely valuable to your future career aspirations.
VIEW

Home / Study With Us / How You Study




HOW YOU
          STUDY        

THIS IS EDUCATION FOR THE BOLD AND THE BRAVE. THIS IS EDUCATION EVOLVED. THIS IS UA92.








WHY CHOOSE UA92?
AN ACADEMIC MODEL FOR THE GAME CHANGERS OF TOMORROW
WE OFFER AN IMMERSIVE EDUCATION THAT WORKS FOR PEOPLE WITH BIG AMBITIONS AND REAL LIVES TO JUGGLE.




DELIBERATELY DIFFERENT





STUDY ONE SUBJECT MODULE AT A TIME





FOCUS ON CHARACTER & PERSONAL DEVELOPMENT





STRAIGHTFORWARD AM / PM TIMETABLE





MULTIPLE START DATES





NO TRADITIONAL END-OF-YEAR EXAMS





COACHING & MENTORING





AN INDUSTRY-INSPIRED EDUCATION





DEGREES AWARDED BY LANCASTER UNIVERSITY






MULTIPLE START DATES
At UA92, we have multiple intakes. You can start your studies in September, November, January, February, April or June*.
*Start dates for our different types of courses may vary. See our courses for the most up to date information on start dates.
APPLY NOW





AN INNOVATIVE, NEW APPROACH TO LEARNING.
WE PUT CHARACTER AND PERSONAL DEVELOPMENT AT THE CORE OF YOUR LEARNING EXPERIENCE, WITH A STRONG EMPHASIS ON WORK ETHIC.
YOU WILL TAKE ON A SERIES OF INDUSTRY PROJECTS TO BUILD YOUR UNDERSTANDING OF THE WORKING WORLD AND DEVELOP THE SKILLS NEEDED FOR GRADUATE EMPLOYMENT.
MORE





COMPARE MODES OF STUDY

USE OUR DEGREE COMPARISON TO FIND OUT WHICH ROUTE IS BEST SUITED TO YOU.





DEGREE


CERT HE LEVEL (1 YEAR)


ACCELERATED DEGREE (2 YEAR)


FULL TIME DEGREE (3 YEAR)

4 STUDY BLOCKS PER YEAR EACH 6 WEEKS LONG

1 SUBJECT MODULE PER STUDY BLOCK ALL ASSOCIATED CPD MODULES


1 SUBJECT MODULE PER STUDY BLOCK 1 CPD MODULE PER YEAR

SEPTEMBER, JANUARY OR APRIL


SEPTEMBER, NOVEMBER, JANUARY, FEBRUARY, APRIL OR JUNE

THE KEY DETAILS
YOUR TIMETABLE WILL REMAIN FIXED THROUGHOUT YOUR STUDIES TO MAKE IT EASIER TO ORGANISE YOUR LIFE WHILST YOU’RE A STUDENT*.
We want to make education work for you, allowing you to find the time to fit in part-time work, sporting commitments, additional hobbies, voluntary work, additional personal development, or career enhancement activities.
*If you start in February, April or June, or as an accelerated student, we don’t guarantee that your timetable will be fixed AM/PM.
 
KEY DATES





Hear from our Alumni



Emily Severn
BA (Hons) Physical Education 



Emily went on to do a Masters’ degree in Journalism and is currently teaching English in Suzhou, China and focusing on her music career in her free time.  
“In April, I was invited to the BBC Radio Nottingham studio by Dean Jackson to discuss my song “City Nights.” The confidence I now have to speak on the radio is thanks to the presentation-based assignments at UA92. These experiences prepared me for public speaking, a crucial aspect of my music career. UA92 not only provided me with degree-specific skills but also transferable ones, enhancing my confidence and belief in my abilities.”






Huma Asghar Baksh
BA (Hons) Business Management 



After 18 months as Marketing & Business Development Executive at Gately, Huma has recently taken up a new role as Paid Social & Performance Trainee at WYK Digital.
“Looking back, now I realise I’ve come such a long way. I have so much more confidence now and I overcome my fear of public speaking. I have clear goals and I know what I want to achieve. I would say to anyone thinking about coming to UA92, you can do it! Even if you doubt yourself in the beginning, there is so much help and support available. It’s the best place to study in Manchester!”  






Kieran O’Connor
BA (Hons) Journalism 



Kieran currently works as a Business Journalist at SBC, writing about Sports Business and the payments landscape.
“During my time at UA92, I honed my skills in multimedia storytelling, which has been invaluable in my professional journey. The person I was when I graduated was ambitious and eager to make an impact. Now, I’m not only experienced, but also committed to continuous learning and growth, striving to apply the lessons in resilience from UA92 every day.”






Matt Richards
BSc (Hons) Computer Science 



Matt is now an Analyst at 3vrm, helping organisations to manage risk through their 3rd party supply chain and vendor relationships. 
“I was told at a young  age that I wasn’t “academic”, I dropped out of college due to lack of interest, and then made a living talking. I left a job I was pretty good at to go and do something completely different and study Computer Science at UA92. Computer science was something I wanted to do, and maybe equally as important, I wanted to PROVE that I could do. I did alright on that final point in the end!?”






Tengku Asila
BA (Hons) Media & Communications 



Asila is now a Social Media Designer in Kuala Lumpur, where she creates social media content for clients in the beauty and lifestyle industry.
“UA92 has shaped me in a way where I have better time management skills and it has help me become more resilient. From my 3 years in UA92, I have not just aced my academics but also developed my soft skills which was one of the key factors that stood me out from the other fresh graduates when I was looking for a job.”

Home / Study With Us / Accelerated Degrees




Accelerated
          Degrees        

GRADUATE FASTER AND GET READY FOR THE WORLD OF WORK WITH AN ACCELERATED DEGREE.








Accelerated Degrees
As an accelerated degree student, you will still benefit from all the same experiences and opportunities as the rest of the UA92 students, but you will achieve a full degree awarded by Lancaster University in two years, not three.
Accelerated degrees are the perfect solution for those who want to complete their studies and enter the world of work much faster, with the overall cost being 20% less than the standard three-year degrees on offer.





ENTRY POINTS
At UA92 we want to make education work for you, which is why you can start your accelerated degree in January, April, or September so you can start when it suits you.
HOW DO I STUDY AN ACCELERATED DEGREE?
Accelerated degrees are the perfect solution for those who want to complete their studies and enter the world of work much faster, with the overall cost being 20% less than the standard three-year degrees on offer* (Home students only).
Over the course of the two years, the cost will amount to 20% less than our three-year programmes* (Home students only)
For more information on our fees and finance as well as available support, see here.
READ MORE





INTERNATIONAL STUDENTS
International students are welcome to apply to study a two-year accelerated degree at UA92. For more information about entry criteria and how to apply as an international student, see here.

Home / Study With Us / Fast Forward




Fast
          Forward        





MAKE A MOVE THAT COULD CHANGE YOUR LIFE.
HIGHER EDUCATION IS NOT OUT OF REACH. WE BELIEVE IT’S NEVER TOO LATE TO PURSUE YOUR DREAMS.


YOU DON’T ALWAYS NEED TRADITIONAL QUALIFICATIONS TO GO TO UNI. OUR STUDENTS COME FROM ALL WALKS OF LIFE. AT UA92, WE TAKE INTO ACCOUNT SKILLS AND KNOWLEDGE DEVELOPED THROUGH VARIOUS LIFE OR WORK-RELATED EXPERIENCES.
FIND OUT HOW TO MAKE YOUR DEGREE A REALITY WITH FAST FORWARD.









WHAT IS FAST FORWARD?
FAST FORWARD IS A FREE SHORT COURSE TO HELP YOU ON YOUR JOURNEY TO HIGHER EDUCATION.

DEVELOP THE CONFIDENCE TO APPLY TO STUDY A DEGREE OR CERT HE
UNDERSTAND THE BENEFITS AND CHALLENGES THAT FACE ADULT LEARNERS
BOOST YOUR AWARENESS OF THE DIFFERENT ROUTES TO DEGREE-LEVEL STUDY

*Fast Forward doesn’t guarantee direct access to higher education or progression onto a UA92 undergraduate course.





WHAT WILL I LEARN? 



You will develop skills in communication, reflection and critical thinking, putting character and personal development at the core of your studies and teaching through a variety of methods such as workshops, group activities and presentations.
This includes insight into how to apply for degree courses, student finance, writing your personal statement, pitching with confidence and much more!





WHAT ARE THE ENTRY REQUIREMENTS?



To be considered for this course, you must be at least 19 years old and ideally have achieved a GCSE Maths and English or equivalent Functional Skills Level 2.





WHEN IS IT? 



The next Fast Forward course will start on Monday 24th February and run for 1 week. You will be required to attend sessions at our UA92 Business School in Salford, every weekday evening from 5:30pm-7pm .
 





WHAT COMES NEXT? 



This could be the start of your journey to higher education. Throughout the programme, we will advise you on which pathways might be available for you, and any associated entry requirements.
We will support you throughout the entire process, and we’ll also be here to help guide your next steps into an exciting future.





IS FAST FORWARD LIKE THE ACCESS TO HE COURSE?



An Access to Higher Education course is a level 3 qualification that can typically be completed in 1 year and is widely recognised by UK Universities. However, depending on your previous experience and/or educational qualifications you may be eligible to apply for a UA92 course without completing an Access to HE course. Fast Forward is a 1 week short course that aims to help prepare you for Higher Education and support you on to the correct pathway.

Hear Kelsey's Story
 

Success Stories
Sports Coach. Uni Sceptic. UA92 Student.
The Fast Forward course was Kelsey’s ticket back to education. She’s now working towards her dream career by studying Sports Coaching at UA92. 
“After leaving college, I started coaching sports, a job I absolutely loved! I did some coaching qualifications but realised that if I wanted to progress as a coach, I needed to look at higher education. I knew it wasn’t straight forward as I didn’t have traditional qualifications and I had been out of education for a while. Someone recommended the Fast Forward course at UA92 so I took a leap of faith and signed myself up. After a week on the course I knew I wanted to come here and after initially doing a Cert HE, I’m now in the second year of my degree.”









MATT RICHARDS, COMPUTER SCIENCE STUDENT
Matt completed the Fast Forward course in 2021 and is now in the third year of a Computer Science degree at UA92.
“I was self-employed for 10 years and reached a point where I wanted to do something different. I phoned a number of universities but when I spoke to the Admissions team at UA92, I felt like they were genuinely trying to help me get where I wanted to be.
“Without the Fast Forward course, I wouldn’t have known where to start. I didn’t have traditional A-levels so it helped me understand the best way for me to get onto a degree course. Everything was explained and it finally made sense. The staff are amazing – they are so invested in you achieving your goals. When I got an unconditional offer on a Digital course, everyone was celebrating.”

Home / Study With Us / International Students




INTERNATIONAL
          STUDENTS        






FEEL AT HOME AT UA92
At UA92, our mission is to make higher education accessible for all, including those overseas. UA92 Global offers specialist advice and support for international students looking to maximise their potential. From your application and visa submission to arrival and accommodation, the UA92 Global team are there for you every step of the way.
Depending on your academic and English level, you can apply for entry onto our foundation, integrated year one or degree level study. You will be fully taught at one of the UA92 campuses in Manchester and can begin your studies at any of our multiple entry points.





WHAT MAKES UA92 THE PERFECT STUDY DESTINATION FOR INTERNATIONAL STUDENTS?
 





DEGREES AWARDED BY LANCASTER UNIVERSITY
As a UA92 graduate with a Lancaster University degree, you will be globally employable.
Lancaster University is in good company amongst many other top UK Universities, and the major league tables prove that.
Lancaster degrees are highly regarded in not only the UK but your home country and anywhere else in the world! *
Find out more about our unique partnership with Lancaster University here.
*UA92 degrees are awarded by Lancaster University, but taught at the UA92 Campus in Old Trafford, Manchester.






One of the World’s Best International Student Cities (QS Best Student Cities Rankings 2022)
3rd Best City in the World (Time Out 2021)
1/5 of Manchester’s Students are International (2021)
No 1 Most Liveable City in the UK (EIU’s Global Liveability Survey 2021)

Aside from its impressive accolades and rankings, Manchester stands proud with its international sporting venues, a thriving art and culture scene and authentic food which represents the rich multicultural community.
Learn more about the glorious city of Manchester here.


MANCHESTER:
A HOME FROM HOME
 



Find out more on the UA92 Global Website

Home / Study With Us / Financial Support Packages




Financial Support
          Packages        





WORRIED YOU CAN’T AFFORD IT?


WE BELIEVE THAT HIGHER EDUCATION SHOULD BE ACCESSIBLE FOR ALL WHICH IS WHY AT UA92, WE OFFER MULTIPLE DIFFERENT ROUTES TO ACCESSING HIGHER EDUCATION AND STUDYING AT DEGREE LEVEL.
EXPLORE OUR DIFFERENT FINANCIAL SUPPORT PACKAGES AND SEE HOW YOU CAN GET EXTRA SUPPORT IN UNLOCKING YOUR DREAM CAREER.









MAKE IT FOR REAL
There are more hidden costs to higher education than often realised. Our Make it for Real package ensures you have all the essentials you need for successful study, providing you with a Microsoft Surface device, unlimited data, free travel, lunch every day and a home voucher as part of a support package worth £5,000*.
Make It For Real









BURSARY 92
The Bursary 92 funding programme gives philanthropists from across Greater Manchester the chance to change the lives of young people in their local communities.
As part of Bursary 92, The Moulding Foundation is supporting 25 students from disadvantaged backgrounds with £10,000 grants while they study at UA92.
UA92 applicants will be assessed and contacted if eligible.
Bursary 92









REBOOT
We are offering 92 grants of £5,000 to anyone from the Greater Manchester community that has been financially impacted by coronavirus, to help them access higher education. Our Reboot grants will enable those who are out of work, or living on reduced means, to study for a degree or a shorter course with us here at UA92.
Reboot









TALENTED ATHLETE PROGRAMME
Our Sport92 Talented Athlete Programme is designed to support student athletes who are competing at a high-level in their sport. If you are eligible, you could get financial awards and support services to help you balance your academic and sporting commitments. This can include a gym membership, sport science support, equipment expenses and travel costs..
Sport 92

Home / Study With Us / Financial Support Packages / Make It For Real



MAKE IT
          FOR REAL        













LIFE IS WHAT YOU MAKE IT.
SO MAKE IT COUNT.


WE BELIEVE EVERYONE DESERVES THE OPPORTUNITY TO MAKE IT FOR REAL, SO WE ARE OFFERING A FREE PACKAGE WORTH £5,000* TO SUPPORT YOU IN ACCESSING HIGHER EDUCATION AND UNLOCKING THE CAREER OF YOUR DREAMS.
APPLY





THINK PEOPLE LIKE YOU DON’T GO TO UNIVERSITY? THINK AGAIN.



There are more hidden costs to higher education than often realised and as our vision is to make higher education accessible for all, we’re removing some of these barriers that many people face when considering their future life.
Our Make it for Real package ensures you have all the essentials you need for successful study.






EARN WHILE YOU LEARN.



With a fixed morning or afternoon timetable, and multiple intake dates throughout the year, you can fit your life around your studies and make it work for you.
Whether it be part-time work, a hobby, caring commitments or even a side-hustle, our goal is to be flexible enough to help you continue to build your future and really make it for real.





WORRIED YOU CAN’T AFFORD IT?



You’ll only start repaying your student loan once you graduate and earn over £25,000 per year, and even then, you only pay 9% of what you earn over that.
If you earned £30k a year, you’d pay approximately £1.20 a day. That’s the equivalent of a packet of crisps. So are you ready salted, or ready to make it?
Please check the gov.uk website for more information on repaying your student loan.





WONDERING IF YOU’RE ELIGIBLE?



If you’re currently aged 17-20 and are in receipt of free school meals, or you were in your last year at school or college then it’s likely you’re eligible for our Make it for Real package.
* See our terms and conditions here.

Home / Study With Us / Financial Support Packages / Reboot




Reboot
          Grant        

OUR COVID-19 EDUCATION GRANT SCHEME







HAVE YOU BEEN FINANCIALLY IMPACTED BY CORONAVIRUS?


We are offering 92 grants of £5,000 to anyone* from Greater Manchester that has been financially impacted by coronavirus, to help them access higher education.
Our Reboot grants will enable those who are out of work, or living on reduced means, to study for a degree or a shorter course with us here at UA92.









HOW DO I APPLY FOR A REBOOT GRANT?
Think you could be eligible for the grant? If you have a Greater Manchester postcode on your application and you’ve applied to study with us, we will contact you to request further information to confirm your eligibility for the Reboot grant.
You can see our full eligibility criteria below.




ELIGIBILITY
To be eligible for a Reboot Grant you must meet criteria 1, at least one of criteria 2, and have also made UA92 your firm choice upon your application for study.


CRITERIA 1:

You are a resident of a Greater Manchester postcode.

CRITERIA 2:

You have lost your job on or after 1st March 2020.

or

You are the child or spouse of a person(s) who has lost their job on or after 1st March 2020.

or

You are in receipt of Universal credit at the point of application, or the child or spouse of a person(s) who is receipt of Universal credit.










THE GRANT
Reboot recipients will receive their £5,000 grant paid directly to them in instalments over three years. Students who study for a Cert HE without progressing to a degree course will receive £1,667 in instalments.
*Terms and conditions apply, see here. Reboot grants are not applicable for those already studying at UA92. Grants are awarded on a first come, first served basis.

Home / Study With Us / Apprenticeships at UA92




Apprenticeships
          At UA92        

Want to start an apprenticeship or employ an apprentice? 
Looking to develop skills that are integral in a modern digital landscape? 
UA92 train qualified specialists with real-world, on-the-job experience.







UPSKILL OR
RESKILL?


UA92 are a forward-thinking, deliberately different education provider. We believe industry-led education is the future and character and personal development is equally important.
Find out more below about our digital apprenticeships in Manchester.





Become An Apprentice
UA92 Apprentices develop an in depth understanding of relevant theory and practice. This knowledge underpins your day-to-day role within your employer organisation. A standard delivery model will mean you study 1 day a week on the UA92 campus in Manchester. The rest of your time is spent within your employer organisation.
The apprenticeships are 12-18 month training programmes. You will study a series of compulsory modules and have the opportunity to complete other industry recognised qualifications such as Amazon Web Services (AWS), Microsoft Azure and Google Cloud Platform (GCP).
Our unique and immersive programme will accelerate your career potential in the digital sector.
You will need to meet the minimum qualification requirements or equivalent levels of industry experience for entry onto the programme.





Become An Employer
Develop your workforce with skills that are integral in a modern digital workplace. As your training provider, UA92 will work with you to develop a delivery model that works for your business needs.
Our integrated Character and Personal development programme is a game-changer. It develops key competencies to further enhance work-place performance.
Our vendor partnerships provide access to additional learning and industry qualifications including Microsoft, Amazon Web Service, CompTIA and many others.
What’s more, we can also help you to assess your candidates/employees ability to successfully achieve the requirements to complete the apprenticeship programme.




WHY CHOOSE UA92?





A GAME CHANGING CAMPUS
We offer a vibrant learning environment with innovative teaching spaces and specialist hubs. Our new Digital Academy has all the latest industry technology for developing practical digital skills.





Industry-led
teaching
The UA92 tutors have on-the-job experience so they understand your working environment, use relevant examples and develop in-demand skills to meet industry needs.





A Supportive Environment
This includes access to all our on campus support, guidance and counselling services. Plus Character and Personal Development, building essential skills needed for the workplace.






 

Unlock the power of apprenticeships at UA92
A BCS spotlight on UA92’s and THG’s DevOps apprenticeship that highlights the partnership between both organisations and why more employers need to take on more apprentices.



Current Opportunities








Approved and awarded by the BCS, The Chartered Institute of IT. A Devops apprenticeship will future-proof your career by giving you a broad spectrum of skills that are in high-demand across a number of sectors.

Learn More

Level 4 DevOps Engineer







Approved and awarded by the BCS, The Chartered Institute of IT. A Data Analyst apprenticeship will future-proof your career by giving you a broad spectrum of skills that are in high-demand across a number of sectors.
Learn More

Level 4 Data Analyst

Home / Study With Us / Apprenticeships at UA92 / Level 3 Multi-Channel Marketer Apprenticeship




Level 3
          Multi Channel Marketer        






Course Information
Multi-Channel Marketer apprentices are responsible for planning and executing marketing campaigns across various digital and offline channels to promote a business’s products or services and engage customers effectively.
They work with diverse teams to create cohesive marketing strategies that leverage social media, email, web content, SEO, PPC, and traditional marketing techniques. Through our programme, apprentices will learn how to integrate these channels to maximise reach and impact.





What is a Multi Channel Marketer



The role of a Multi-Channel Marketer is dynamic and critical in today’s competitive business landscape. It involves creativity, strategic thinking, and a deep understanding of consumer behaviour. This role can significantly enhance an organisation’s brand presence and customer engagement.





Why should I become a Multi-Channel Marketer?



The Level 3 Multi-Channel Marketer Apprenticeship will open up many opportunities for you to work across various marketing roles in different industries.
The marketing sector is constantly evolving with the advent of new technologies and platforms. Becoming a Multi-Channel Marketer means you’ll be at the forefront of this innovation, adapting and thriving in a fast-paced environment.





What skills will I learn?



What you will learn:

How to develop and execute comprehensive marketing campaigns that integrate multiple channels.
Understand the principles of digital marketing, including SEO, PPC, social media marketing, and email marketing.
Knowledge of traditional marketing methods and how to combine them with digital strategies.
Analyse market trends, customer data, and campaign performance to optimise marketing efforts.
Develop skills in content creation, branding, and communication.
Understand how to measure and report on the effectiveness of marketing activities.
Experience using marketing tools and platforms like Google Analytics, HubSpot, and social media management tools.






What jobs or roles will I be able to do?



Multi-Channel Marketer Apprentices typically take up roles such as Digital Marketing Executive, Social Media Coordinator, SEO Specialist, Content Marketer, Email Marketing Specialist, Marketing Analyst, Campaign Manager, and Brand Ambassador.
Combining traditional and digital marketing techniques helps to create a seamless customer journey and ensures consistent brand messaging across all platforms.

Home / Study With Us / Apprenticeships at UA92 / Level 4 Data Analyst Apprenticeship




Level 4
          Data Analyst        

Approved and awarded by the BCS, The Chartered Institute of IT. A Data Analyst apprenticeship will future-proof your career by giving you a broad spectrum of skills that are in high-demand across a number of sectors.








Course Information
A Data Analyst apprenticeship will future-proof your career by providing high-demand skills across various sectors. As a Data Analyst apprentice, you will collect, process, and analyse data to help businesses make informed decisions.
This role spans multiple domains, transforming organisational strategies through data-driven insights. The Level 4 Data Analyst Apprenticeship opens opportunities in industries at the forefront of big data, AI, machine learning, cloud computing, and data visualisation.
You’ll learn to work effectively in teams, understand business environments, and interpret data. With access to leading platforms and real-life experience, you’ll be prepared for roles such as Data Analyst, Business Intelligence Analyst, Data Scientist, Data Engineer, and Research Analyst






What is a Data Analyst?



Data Analysts are responsible for collecting, processing, and analysing data to help businesses make informed decisions. They ensure that data is accurate, reliable, and used effectively to meet an organisation’s needs. They also monitor data quality and provide insights to improve business operations and strategies.





Why should I become a Data Analyst?



The Data Analyst is one of the most exciting roles in the digital sector. It spans across multiple domains, transforming an organisation’s ability to make data-driven decisions and strategies.
The Level 4 Data Analyst Apprenticeship will open up many opportunities for you to work across a range of industries.
The sector is at the forefront of developing technologies like big data, Artificial Intelligence (AI), machine learning, cloud computing, and data visualisation.
Data analysis aims to bring together the seamless collaboration between data collection and business insights. The digital industry is a hive of activity, and it’s time to step up and make your mark.





What skills will I learn?






What you will learn:

How to work effectively as part of a team and understand the business environment for both data management and analysis projects.
Understand how to interpret and analyse data to provide valuable insights.
What are the different roles within a data team, such as data engineers and data scientists.
Data analysis concepts, underpinned by industry-standard vendor-certified technology, including data analytics, data visualisation, statistical analysis, machine learning, and cloud computing.
Skills in collecting, analysing, and interpreting data to drive business decisions.

You will get access to a wide range of courses, tools, and labs from leading platforms like Amazon Web Services (AWS) and Microsoft Azure and have the opportunity to access additional learning and support through our vendor partnerships, including Microsoft, CompTIA and more.
You will gain real-life experience exploring the core underlying data analysis concepts, skills, and knowledge.








What jobs or roles will I be able to do?



Data Analyst Apprentices typically take up roles such as Data Analyst, Business Intelligence Analyst, Data Scientist, Data Engineer, and Research Analyst.
Combining data analysis skills with business insights helps organisations make informed decisions, optimise operations, and drive strategic initiatives.

Home / Study With Us / Apprenticeships at UA92 / Level 4 DevOps Apprenticeship




Level 4 Apprenticeship
          DevOps        

Approved and awarded by the BCS, The Chartered Institute of IT. A Devops apprenticeship will future-proof your career by giving you a broad spectrum of skills that are in high-demand across a number of sectors.








Unlock Your
Greatness
Apply for a Level 4 DevOps apprenticeship and future proof your career. Develop a broad range of digital skills that are in high demand.






What is a Level 4 DevOps Apprenticeship?



DevOps Engineer Apprentices are responsible for ensuring that a business’s underlying technology and infrastructure is running smoothly and that software, systems and tools are working as expected to meet customer’s needs.
They also look after and monitor critical services and applications to ensure maximum availability and minimal downtime. Through our programme, apprentices will learn the DevOps culture and software engineering disciplines to automate and codify infrastructure.





Why should I become a DevOps Engineer?



The DevOps Engineer is one of the most exciting roles in the digital sector. It spans across multiple domains. The role can transform an organisation’s ability to deliver applications and services at pace and scale.
The Level 4 DevOps Apprenticeship will open up many opportunities for you to work across a range of IT roles.
The sector is leading the way on developing technologies like The Internet of Things (IoT), Artificial Intelligence (AI), big data, cloud, automation, microservices and serverless technologies.
DevOps aims to bring together the seamless collaboration between software development and IT infrastructure. The digital industry is a hive of activity and it’s time to step up and make your mark.





What skills will I learn?




You will learn how to work as part of a team. You will understand the business environment for both the development and technical operations of a project.
You will know and understand how to interpret design documentation and specifications defined. You will learn about different roles of an IT team such as a network engineer or system architect.
You will develop an understanding of  DevOps concepts, underpinned by industry standard vendor certified technology. This includes cyber security, Linux, automation, data analytics, containerisation, IoT, cloud and deployment.
You will get access to a wide range of courses, infrastructure and labs from Amazon Web Services (AWS), Microsoft Azure and Google Cloud Platform (GCP).
You will have the opportunity to access additional learning and support through our vendor partnerships. These include Microsoft, CompTIA, the Linux Professional Institute (LPI) and the Cisco Networking Academy.
You will get real life experiences to explore the core underlying DevOps concepts, skills and knowledge. This will help you to become proficient at creating and deploying applications through CI/CD tools.






What jobs or roles will I be able to do?



Dev Ops Apprentices typically take up roles such as Automation Engineer, Build and Release Engineer, Deployment Engineer, DevOps Engineer, Full-stack Developer, Infrastructure Engineer, Platform Engineer, Reliability Engineer and Site Reliability Engineer
Combining software development and IT operations helps to shorten the development lifecycle and ensure continuous delivery for your organisation.

Bootcamp detail

Full Title: Skills Bootcamp in Data Analytics

Starts: We don’t have a scheduled start date for this bootcamp. Sign up below for updates.

Duration: 16 weeks

Cost: Free

Level: Beginner

Time: Weekdays (1pm-5pm)

Location: Online



About this bootcamp

The Skills Bootcamp in Data Analytics provides learners with a complete understanding of data processing life cycles. You will have the opportunity to gain an internationally recognised CompTIA qualification. This validates your ability to facilitate data-driven business decisions including mining data, manipulating data, visualising and reporting data, applying basic statistical methods and analysing complex datasets. You will also develop an understanding of the governance and quality standards that apply throughout the entire data life cycle. This program is the ideal kickstarter for those with no prior tech knowledge to enter the workforce as skilled Data Analysts and Business Intelligence Analysts.
Read More





BOOTCAMP DETAIL

Full Title: Skills Bootcamp in Cloud Engineering with Cyber Security & Web Development

Start: We don’t have a scheduled start date for this bootcamp. Sign up below for updates.

Duration: 16 Weeks

Level: Beginner

Cost: Free

Time: Weekdays (1pm-5pm)

Location: Online



About this course

This Skills Bootcamp in Cloud Computing provides learners with a comprehensive introduction and overview of cloud-based principles and networking concepts. Learners have the opportunity to gain an internationally recognised CompTIA qualification. This validates your ability to deploy and automate secure cloud environments that support high availability of business systems and data. This bootcamp will help you gain knowledge of cloud concepts, management and technical operations and business principles of cloud environments. This bootcamp is the ideal kickstarter for anyone looking to become a cloud engineer.
Read More

WHAT DO SKILLS BOOTCAMPS OFFER?
Skills Bootcamps at UA92, help individuals to develop a range of in-demand digital skills, creating opportunities for employment or career progression.
Skills Bootcamps are also a game-changer for forward-thinking organisations who need to re-train or reskill their workforce.
The bootcamps are delivered 100% online, perfect for fitting around other commitments.





WHO ARE SKILLS BOOTCAMPS FOR?
Why a Skills Bootcamp could be for you!

Learners must be aged 19+
No prior knowledge of tech is required
Develop a wide range of digital skills required by employers.
Benefit from a guaranteed tech job interview with a local employer on successful completion.
Work on projects that enable you to build a portfolio to showcase your experience and expertise.
Build Character and Personal Development.
Daytime, online study to fit around other life or family commitments.






NEIL UDDIN
CLOUD ENGINEERING
“After a 15-year career in the Parachute Regiment I was medically discharged. Starting a new career was a daunting prospect. I saw an advert on social media for the Skills for Life Bootcamp and applied. I didn’t have a tech background so I was a bit nervous. Now I can launch an EC2 virtual machine in a specific region around the globe. I have also developed coding skills and knowledge of computer languages including Python.”
Read Neil's Story





KEVIN WONG
CLOUD ENGINEERING
“I am a qualified schoolteacher. I wanted to do the Skills for Life bootcamp so that I could take the next steps in my career. I’ve always had a passion for digital. The industry is growing so quickly, and technology is evolving at a very fast pace. It’s important to keep up with what’s happening and develop new skills when you can. “
Read Kevin's Story





EBUKA NWABUEZE
METAVERSE & VR
“I graduated with a degree in English Language and Literature and have worked in Sales ever since. I managed to establish a good career but I knew my passion was somewhere else. I’m fascinated with the Metaverse and the technology and innovation behind it. I don’t have a tech background, so I wasn’t sure how to start a new career in this field.”
Read Ebuka's Story





WHAT ARE SKILLS BOOTCAMPS?



Skills Bootcamps are free, flexible courses of up to 16 weeks, giving people the opportunity to build up sector-specific skills and fast-track to an interview with an employer.
Skills Bootcamps are part of the Government’s Lifetime Skills Guarantee, helping everyone gain skills for life.
 





WHAT WILL I LEARN?



Skills Bootcamps help individuals and organisations to develop a range of in-demand digital skills, improving job prospects or enabling career progression.
Choose from Skills Bootcamps in Cyber Security, Cloud Engineering, Computer Science, Extended Reality or Data Analytics.





HOW WILL I LEARN?



The Skills Bootcamps are delivered entirely online so you can study from home or place of work.





WHO ARE BOOTCAMPS FOR?



You must be:

Age 19+
Live in England
Proficient in English language and writing.
No previous tech experience is required.
No specific qualification are needed.






HOW MUCH DOES IT COST?



Skills Bootcamps completely free for individuals. Skills Bootcamps are part of the Government’s Lifetime Skills Guarantee, helping everyone gain skills for life.





HOW DO I APPLY?



Simply fill in the enquiry form above and a member of the team will be in touch to discuss your requirements and application process in more detail.

Home / Study With Us / Online Digital Bootcamps




Online Digital
          Bootcamps        

Are you an open source enthusiast, or simply want to learn more? Take your first step to becoming a Linux Systems Administrator with our Online Linux Essentials Bootcamp. Whether you’re starting out in your career or wanting to enhance your skill set, this Linux course is a flexible way to gain an internationally recognised qualification.
 







About the course


Duration: 4 days (4.5 hours per session)



Delivery: Online via Microsoft Teams 



Qualification: LPI Linux Essentials 








What will the course cover?
Develop a working knowledge of Linux using both open source applications and the Command Line. This introduction to Linux course will provide hands-on learning with online lessons and guided practice.
Course material includes:
• Finding your way in Linux Systems
• Open source applications in the workplace
• The power of the Command Line and how to work on it
• Basic concepts of the Linux Operating System
• Security and File Permissions for public and private directories
This bootcamp will prepare you for the LPI Linux Essential certification exam. You will receive a voucher to redeem against the cost of the exam, which you can arrange to take online or at a certified test centre, upon completion of the bootcamp.




Linux Essentials bootcamp will give you:


High-demand skills in Linux Operating Systems
Linux is used by 96.3% of the top million web servers, and 47% of professional developers worldwide.


An internationally recognised qualification
Kickstart your next job or promotion by independently verifying your skill set.


A route to the Advanced PLIC Professional Certificate
On completion, you can take your qualification a step further with the Advanced PLIC Professional Certificate.







You can do the Linux Essentials course if you:
 

want to advance your career in open source.
have some experience with programming and/or scripting.
understand the basics of the cloud and/or cloud technologies.
have knowledge of networking and/or cloud networking.
are an individual or business wanting to up skill, re-skill or cross skill.

This Linux course is designed for individuals who wish to gain an international industry-recognised qualification which is focused on the core foundational skills needed to work with Linux Operating Systems.




Requirements
No previous knowledge is required, so whether you’re a complete beginner or looking to enhance your tech skills, this course is for you! All you need is a computer with an internet connection to participate in the online classes.


Cost
(Introductory price) £500+VAT
Includes all materials, online guided lessons and the exam voucher. Full payment must be made before the course starts.
Email us at [email protected] to sign up or find out more.

Home / Study With Us / Character & Personal Development




CHARACTER & PERSONAL
          DEVELOPMENT        





AN INNOVATIVE
APPROACH TO
LEARNING


WE PUT CHARACTER AND PERSONAL DEVELOPMENT AT THE CORE OF YOUR LEARNING EXPERIENCE WITH A STRONG EMPHASIS ON BUILDING SKILLS THAT EMPLOYERS WANT. IT WILL EMPOWER YOUR SELF-BELIEF, UNLOCK CHARACTER-DEFINING EXPERIENCES AND PREPARE YOU FOR SUCCESS BEYOND UA92.





92 PROGRAMME
At UA92, you will follow the same principles that made the Class of 92 one of the most successful teams of all time. Taking inspiration from their former manager, Sir Alex Ferguson, the Class of 92 have reimagined the higher education experience. By developing both academic knowledge with learned life skills, you will be fully prepared for future beyond your degree.
This is more than a degree. This is preparation for life.





“AT UA92 WE BELIEVE THAT SUCCESS IS DOWN TO MORE THAN LUCK AND TALENT. IT’S ABOUT WORKING HARD TO BE YOUR BEST SELF. STRIVING TO ACHIEVE YOUR DREAMS. AND NEVER GIVING UP UNTIL YOU’VE MADE IT.”
GARY NEVILLE, UA92 CO-FOUNDER




The 92 Programme is embedded into every block of your study. In each block, you will have character and personal development focus days. Some of these days are specifically related to your subject area. During these focus days, you will complete activities designed to boost your mindset, develop your skillset and get you set for future success.


HOW DOES THE PROGRAMME WORK?





MINDSET
SKILLSET
GET SET



Your mindset has an impact on everything you do.
Our sessions on personal strengths, growth mindset and building resilience, will boost your confidence and self-awareness so you can become the best version of yourself.


Everyone has a unique skillset based on personal interests and future aspirations.
This is an opportunity for you to upskill in areas such as digital, finance, enterprise, media, wellness, adding to the technical skills and expertise you will build throughout your degree study.


It’s more than a degree – it’s preparation for life.
We work with our industry partners to help you build the professional behaviours and employability skills you need to succeed when you start your career.






COACHING &
MENTORING
YOU WILL HAVE ACCESS TO A TEAM OF QUALIFIED COACHES & INDUSTRY MENTORS THROUGHOUT YOUR STUDIES. IT’S A GREAT OPPORTUNITY IF YOU ARE LOOKING FOR ADVICE AND GUIDANCE FROM AN INDUSTRY PROFESSIONAL OR WANT HELP TO ACHIEVE A PERSONAL OR PROFESSIONAL GOAL.




GraduateStories




The character and personal development modules really helped me with things like goal setting. It's definitely something I have used a lot in my role at KPMG but also in my day-to-day life as well.
Troy Wood

Home / Study With Us / TASS Dual Career Accreditation Scheme



TASS Dual Career Accreditation Scheme

The TASS Dual career accreditation scheme allows athletes to reach their potential in education, alongside achieving success in their sport. TASS formally recognises UA92’s commitment to academic support and flexibility for talented athletes who also wish to study in higher education.







HOW DOES IT WORK?
Dual Career student-athletes are directly assigned to our qualified Dual Career Coordinator (DCC), who will support you in balancing your studies amongst your hectic sporting schedules.


Our uniquely structured timetable, curriculum delivery and assessments provide an unmatchable opportunity for athletes to achieve success in both their education and sporting potential without having to choose between the two.









OUR COMMITMENT TO STUDENT-ATHLETES
As a UA92 TASS Student-Athlete, you will benefit from:

Access to exclusive workshops, including nutrition, finance, anti-doping, interview techniques and well-being.
An individual learner support plan.
Regular 1-2-1 meetings with our Dual Career Coordinator.
Academic catchups and extensions in exceptional circumstances.
A guarantee to be fully flexible, so you will never have to choose between education or sport.
Studying any of our degrees in Business, Media, Digital or Sport.






ARE YOU ELIGIBLE?
To be eligible for the TASS Dual-Career scheme, athletes must be competing at a minimum of national or regional level in any recognised sport with an NGB and talent pathway, for example, representing the North West of England.
For more information visit the TASS website or to apply now, email [email protected] .

Home / About UA92 / Our Vision & Philosophy




OUR VISION
          & PHILOSOPHY        

AT UA92 WE BELIEVE IN DELIVERING EDUCATION THAT’S SO MUCH MORE THAN A QUALIFICATION.
IT’S PREPARATION FOR LIFE.








Our vision
GAME-CHANGING LEADERS OF TOMORROW
We believe in giving our students the tools, challenges, support, and confidence to become their best selves and achieve their dreams. Alongside their academic studies, our students embark on a personal development journey to prepare them to reach their full potential and to get them ready for the world of work.





OUR PHILOSOPHY
UNLOCK YOUR GREATNESS
There’s more to success than timing and talent. Tenacity, preparedness, passion, and hard work all play an equally important role. Add commitment, inner fire and the right preparation and you can compete at a level far beyond your inborn potential whether this be delivering the presentation of a lifetime, performing in front of the camera, or chairing the board.




Make it work for you
HOW TO CHOOSE THE RIGHT COURSE


Your journey is unique
That’s why we offer a number of different ways to study. Let’s break down your options.






1
CHOOSE YOUR DEGREE TYPE



CERT HE 1 YEAR 







Study a shorter course and get a recognised qualification  with the option to progress to year 2, of the degree course, on completion. Study 4 blocks, each 6 weeks long, and complete in under a year.



ACCELERATED 2 YEARS 







Get ahead faster by putting more study weeks in over the year. It's not all work, work, work. You still get breaks throughout the year. Study 6 blocks, each 6 weeks long,  per year. 



FULL TIME DEGREE 3 YEARS 







The most popular choice. Allow yourself extra time to immerse yourself in student life and enjoy being a student while you can. Study 4 blocks, each 6 weeks long, per year.






2
CHOOSE WHEN YOU START


START YOUR STUDIES IN
SEPTEMBER / NOVEMBER / JANUARY / FEBRUARY / APRIL / JUNE
APPLY




3
CHOOSE WHAT YOU STUDY


COURSES IN
SPORT / MEDIA / DIGITAL / BUSINESS
VIEW ALL





DELIBERATELY DIFFERENT





FOCUS ON CHARACTER & PERSONAL DEVELOPMENT





NO TRADITIONAL END-OF-YEAR EXAMS





STUDY IN THE MORNING OR AFTERNOON





COACHING AND MENTORING AVAILABLE FOR STUDENTS





AN INDUSTRY-INSPIRED EDUCATION





STUDY ONE SUBJECT MODULE AT A TIME



 

WHAT DOES OUR VISION MEAN TO YOU?








As a UA92 student you’ll learn from the very best, enjoying an education designed to help you develop in a more rounded way. You’ll build real-life skills, resilience, and independence so you graduate ready to take on the world.

Our unique approach to learning through Character and Personal Development will help prepare you for life. Combine this with the knowledge you learn and the connections you make along the way, finish off with a degree awarded by top-performing, world-renowned Lancaster University and you’ll see that our unique, winning formula massively benefits you.

STUDENT







We support, believe in, and develop our colleagues to ensure they can develop their career and professional success. After all, our students deserve the very best and how can you be the best unless you’re constantly learning, striving, and bettering yourself too?

We’re always looking for exceptional talent to join Team UA92. The born leaders. The status-quo challenges. The talent supercharges. If you’re hungry for a more rewarding role, look no further. 


CAREER SEEKER?







Enabling opportunities for the next generation is what we’re all about, and it’s your support that helps us do that.

Enjoy the kudos of associating with the best in business, sport media and digital and become an integral part of the evolved education that is UA92.

Your brand will feel the benefits of associating with the Class of 92, whilst your talent pool for both placements and graduate recruitment will be dramatically improved thanks to our game-changing curriculum. 


POTENTIAL PARTNER?







We know that you only want the very best for the people you love, and at UA92 you can rest assured that your child will gain an education like no other.

Our pioneering co-founders, The Class of 92 and Lancaster University, as well as our key strategic partners like Manchester United, Microsoft and TalkTalk, all change the way we think, and deliver, higher education.

We want to support your child in becoming tomorrow’s success story: more resilient, more driven, more employable, and more sought after by top brands and businesses. 


PARENT OR GUARDIAN

Legal information & UA92 board members


University Academy 92 Limited (UA92), a company limited by shares incorporated and based in England, is a joint venture between Lancaster University, and several individual shareholders drawn from former Manchester United footballers the Class of 92 and their associates.
UA92 is registered with the Office for Students and is a registered provider of higher education in England.
DOWNLOAD ANNUAL REPORT








Dr Marnie Millard



Marnie is passionate about inclusivity and talent development, which is why she has chaired the UA92 board ever since the doors officially opened in 2019.  As Former Group Chief Executive of Nichols PLC, the home of Vimto, and current president of the Board of Management at the British Soft Drinks Association (BSDA), Marnie’s successful career in Soft Drinks spans over 25 years, and her involvement as chair for the CBI, and Advisor to the Board of International Trade led to her being awarded an OBE in 2018.






Gary Neville



Gary Neville is Co-Founder of University Academy 92.  Since retiring from football, Gary took up coaching and media roles as well as multiple business projects, including co-founding UA92 with his fellow members of the Class of 92. In the media, Gary is one of the most popular commentators on international broadcasters and at UA92, Gary is an active part of the team.






Greg Wilson



Greg currently holds the position of Non-Executive Director at UA92 and is chair of the Audit and Risk and Remuneration Committees.  A qualified chartered accountant and experienced auditor, Greg was a former partner and National Higher Education Assurance Leader at Pricewaterhouse Coopers (PWC) and is current Director of the National Audit Office (NAO) whilst also helping develop young people through coaching of junior cricket and golf.






Professor Andy Schofield



Andy is the Vice-Chancellor of UA92’s co-founder, Lancaster University.  Andy has an impressive career in the education industry as the former Pro-Vice-Chancellor and Head of the College of Engineering at the University of Birmingham, as well as having studied Natural Sciences followed by a PhD at Gonville and Caius College, with a Royal Society University Research Fellowship award to his name too.






Sara Prowse



As UA92’s CEO, Sara has big ambitions to put the students at the heart of UA92, and position UA92 to be recognised within industry as the place to go for work-ready graduates.  With over 30 years’ experience in retail across all channels to market in the UK, US, and Europe and having led and built iconic names such as Hotter Shoes and what is now The Very Group, Sara is an experienced Consumer Brand CEO who joined the UA92 team in 2021.

The number of offers we have made in relation to those applications.
The number of those offers accepted and the number of those who have registered with us.
The number of students who attained a particular degree or other academic award, or a particular level of such an award, on completion of their course with us.

It also shows these numbers by reference to:

The gender of the individuals to which they relate.
Their ethnicity.
Their socio-economic background.






PUBLICATION SCHEME


UA92 PUBLICATION SCHEME
FOR THE PURPOSE OF THE FREEDOM OF INFORMATION ACT 2000, UNIVERSITY ACADEMY 92 LIMITED IS CLASSED AS A PUBLIC AUTHORITY, MEANING THAT IT IS SUBJECT TO THE ACT AND MUST MAKE CERTAIN INFORMATION PUBLICLY AVAILABLE, INLUDING THE PUBLICATION SCHEME. 

Under the FOIA, public authorities such as UA92 are required to have a publication scheme, telling people about the broad classes of information which public authorities will routinely make available to the public, including information held in any form like websites, paper files and public registers. 
UA92 has adopted the Information Commissioner’s Model Publication Scheme for Higher Education Institutions. The Information Commissioner is an independent regulator who enforces and advises on the FOIA and has produced and approved of this scheme. A copy of our publication scheme can be found here: 
UA92 Publication Scheme 
By adopting this scheme, UA92 has committed to: 

Proactively publish information (including environmental information) which is held by it and contained within each class. 
Provide a means by which UA92 can make the public aware of the types of information it will make readily available, how they can access that information and whether they will have to pay for it. 
Review and update the information on a regular basis. 

The Model Publication Scheme contains seven ‘classes’ of information, of which UA92 is committed to making publicly available: 

Who we are and what we do. 
What we spend and how we spend it. 
What our priorities are and how we are doing. 
How we make decisions. 
Our policies and procedures. 


Lists and registers. 
The services we offer.

FREEDOM OF INFORMATION





WHAT IS FREEDOM OF INFORMATION?



The Freedom of Information Act 2000 (FOI) gives people the general right to see recorded information held by public authorities. Under FOI, anybody may request information from any public authority, including higher education institutions, which has functions in England, Wales and/or Northern Ireland.
The Act confers two statutory rights on applicants;

To be told whether or not the public authority holds the information they request, and if so;
To have that information communicated to them.

The Act means that University Academy 92 Limited is legally required to answer all written enquiries and requests for information from any person or organisation in the world within 20 working days, subject to certain exemptions.
The public also has access to information within the Publication Scheme.





HOW DO I MAKE A FREEDOM OF INFORMATION REQUEST?



You can make a request for information from UA92 Limited under the Freedom of Information Act 2000 by:

Emailing [email protected]
Write to: Data Protection Officer, University Academy 92 Limited, Brian Statham Way, Old Trafford, Manchester, M16 0PU.

To make a valid request, you must include the requester’s real name, a valid address for correspondence, and a clear description of the information you are requesting. The Information Commissioners Office has ruled that applicants must provide their real name and requests using pseudonyms may be refused.





COSTS FOR INFORMATION PROVIDED FOLLOWING AN FOI REQUEST



Information will be made available on request, in cases where it is not practical to include on the website.
Where information cannot be made available free of charge, we may charge to cover the cost of actual disbursements such as photocopying, printing, postage and packaging and the cost directly incurred as a result of viewing information.
Any charges will be specified within the publication scheme and be in accordance with the UA92 policy.





PROCESS FOR MAKING A COMPLAINT ABOUT THE HANDLING OF A FREEDOM OF INFORMATION REQUEST



INTERNAL REVIEW
If you feel the service that you have received does not meet your expectations, please contact [email protected], adding FOI Complaint to the subject line and quoting the Request ID number we issued upon receipt of your request.
Alternatively, you can write to us at Data Protection Officer, University Academy 92 Limited, Brian Statham Way, Old Trafford, Manchester, M16 0PU.
EXTERNAL REVIEW
If you are not satisfied with the outcome of this process, you may appeal to the Information Commissioner by writing to: The Information Commissioner, Information Commissioners Office, Wycliffe House, Water Lance, Wilmslow, Cheshire, SK9 5AF.

OVERVIEW
QUALITY STANDARDS REVIEW 




UA92 approach to quality assurance and enhancement is to:

Ensure that UA92 adopts rigorous processes whilst maintaining flexibility to allow UA92 to develop and mature.
Ensure that they are fit for purpose at this point in UA92’s development but are cognisant of UA92 future development plan.
Satisfy the expectations of external regulators and quality assurance agencies while at the same time serving UA92s and Lancaster University’s quality assurance requirements.
Provide reliable intelligence and promote effective action.
Promote a culture of continuous reflection and improvement to support the delivery of a superlative student experience at UA92.
Put student voice at the heart of decision making at UA92.
Actively and willingly supported and engaged with by key stakeholders, including employees, students, and partners.

3.2 UA92 policies align with expectations for standards as outlined in the UK Quality Code for Higher Education. In particular: 

The academic standards of UA92 courses meet the requirements of the relevant national qualification’s framework.
The value of qualifications awarded to students at the point of qualification and over time is in line with sector-recognised standards.
UA92 Courses are well-designed, provide a high-quality academic experience for all students and enable a student’s achievement to be reliably assessed.
From admission through to completion, all UA92 students are provided with the support that they need to succeed in and benefit from higher education.



Quality and Standards Review is the process the UK Quality Assurance Agency (QAA) uses to provide evidence to the Office for Students (OfS) about whether new providers applying to be on the OfS’s Register meet the Core practices of the UK Quality Code for Higher Education (the Quality Code).
UA92 underwent QSR in January 2020 as part of its application for Registration with the Office for Students.
View our report on the QAA website here.

Home / About UA92 / Our Founders / Lancaster University




Lancaster
          University        

UA92 IS EDUCATION EVOLVED, WITH THE DRIVE, EXPERIENCE AND CONNECTIONS OF THE CLASS OF 92, COMBINED WITH THE ACADEMIC CURIOSITY, REPUTATION AND RIGOUR OF LANCASTER UNIVERSITY, MAKING YOUR DEGREE EXCEPTIONAL.







A DEGREE AWARDED BY LANCASTER
As co-founder of UA92, Lancaster University help design the course and develop learning and study facilities to enable you to thrive.


Whilst your degree is awarded by Lancaster University, the career-accelerating range of business, digital, media and sports courses on offer are only available here at UA92. It’s the best of both worlds.
You’ll study at our campus in Old Trafford and be a UA92 student, but you’ll come out the other side with a respected degree, awarded by one of the UK’s top universities which is highly sought after by employers.




ABOUT LANCASTER UNIVERSITY
Lancaster was first established in 1964 and has been identified as an educational and academic pioneer ever since, ranking in 10th place in The Complete University Guide 2025, 11th in The Guardian University Guide 2024 and 14th in The Times and Sunday Times Good University Guide 2024.
The 2024 edition of the QS World University Rankings also named Lancaster as 141st out of 1,500 universities around the world.


Lancaster’s impressive reputation is further reflected in its top 15 rankings in three UK league tables, and its prominent positions in global university league tables.
“It was through a conversation with Lancaster University that I heard about UA92. I was instantly curious and contacted them to find out more. It wasn’t like any of the traditional universities I’d visited, and I liked that, but I would still get the prestigious degree from Lancaster University which was a bonus! The Lancaster connection was a big draw.” – Alex Keir, UA92 Student
“UA92 offers a different approach to higher education and is a real alternative for people who otherwise may not have chosen to go to university. It’s an excellent choice for those students looking for different ways to learn and increase their life skills, personal networks, and employment prospects.” – Professor Andy Schofield, Vice-Chancellor at Lancaster University.

Home / About UA92 / Our Founders / The Class of 92




THE CLASS
          OF 92        





GIVING BACK TO THE YOUTH OF TODAY


HAVING MET AT MANCHESTER UNITED BACK IN THE EARLY 90S, THE CLASS OF 92 (CO92) HAVE ENJOYED SOME OF THE MOST SUCCESSFUL CAREERS IN FOOTBALL, DRIVING THEIR CLUB, AND COUNTRIES, TO REACH NEW HEIGHTS.
Part of the most successful Premier League football team of all time, the Class of 92 – which includes Gary Neville, Paul Scholes, Ryan Giggs, Nicky Butt, and Phil Neville all went on to excel in highly pressurised and challenging environments in the world of media and as businessmen, after their stellar football careers led by Sir Alex Ferguson.
Their attitude towards preparedness and the ability to dream big as well as their commitment to creating opportunity is recognised all over the world. Now, working with Lancaster University, it’s time to give back.








GARY NEVILLE


GARY IS ONE OF THE MOST DECORATED ENGLISH AND EUROPEAN FOOTBALLERS OF ALL TIME, WITH A TOTAL OF 20 TROPHIES, INCLUDING EIGHT PREMIER LEAGUE TITLES AND TWO CHAMPIONS LEAGUE TITLES.
He spent his whole playing career at Old Trafford, and has represented England as a coach and a player. He’s England’s most-capped right-back, and was Manchester United’s club captain for five years. Now he co-owns Salford City, and since retirement in 2011, has enjoyed success as a coach and a commentator, whilst becoming a successful and ambitious businessman.




RYAN GIGGS


A TALENTED LEFT-WINGER, RYAN GIGGS DEBUTED WITH MANCHESTER UNITED IN 1991 AND WENT ON TO BECOME ONE OF THE MOST DECORATED PLAYERS IN UK HISTORY, HOLDING THE RECORD FOR MOST COMPETITIVE APPEARANCES AT THE CLUB.
Following a successful football career, Ryan went on to become the Player-Manager at Manchester United and since retirement, has acted as an assistant manager supporting Louis Van Gaal.
In 2007, Ryan was appointed an OBE in the Queen’s Birthday Honours List for his services to football, and in 2009 won BBC Sports Personality of the Year. Now, Ryan co-owns Salford City with the rest of the Co92 boys and is invested in several business ventures.




PAUL SCHOLES


THE MOST DECORATED ENGLISH FOOTBALLER OF ALL TIME, PAUL SCHOLES HAS 25 TROPHIES TO HIS NAME, INCLUDING 11 PREMIER LEAGUE TILTES AND TWO CHAMPIONS LEAGUE TITLES.
Like Gary, Paul played for Manchester United for his whole career making 718 appearances: the third-highest number in the club’s history behind Bobby Charlton and Ryan Giggs. Paul is renowned on the pitch for his performance as a well-rounded, tenacious, and versatile player, and off the pitch too as he co-owns Salford City with the rest of the Co92.




PHIL NEVILLE


VERSATILE IN HIS DEFENCE OR MIDFILED, PHIL HELPED MANCHESTER UNITED BRING HOME SIX PREMIER LEAGUE TITLES, 3 FA CHARITY SHIELDS, THE INTERCONTINENTAL CUP, AND THE CHAMPIONS LEAGUE BEFORE MOVING TO EVERTON IN 2005.
After representing England 59 times, Phil went on to earn his coaching license in 2012 and has since inspired success for England Under 21s, Valencia and Manchester United’s 1st team, as well as driving the Lionesses to the 2019 World Cup Semi Finals as the England Women’s National Team Manager.
Now, Phil is the Head Coach of MLS team Inter Miami, and regularly appears on both TV and radio as a popular pundit.




NICKY BUTT


AS THE CO-OWNER OF SALFORD CITY, FORMER ENGLAND PLAYER TURNED COACH, AND HEAD OF COACHING AT THE MANCHESTER UNITED YOUTH ACADEMY, NICKY HAS ENJOYED AN EXCEPTIONAL CAREER ON BOTH THE PITCH ITSELF, AND THE SIDE-LINES.
A top midfielder from 1992 to 2011, Nicky began his career with Manchester United and spent 12 years in their first team, winning 6 Premier League titles, 3 FA Cups, 4 FA Community Shields, the UEFA Champions League, and the Intercontinental Cup.
After this, Nicky spent time with Newcastle United and Birmingham City, alongside winning 39 caps in a seven-year England career.







WHAT DO THEY BRING?
The four subject areas of UA92 connect with the group’s collective expertise, and their passion to impart this to a new generation is unwavering.
With the Class of 92 as UA92’s Co-Founders, our students benefit from their industry connections who provide unrivalled learning opportunities and career development. The principles of UA92 that underpin our curriculum reflect Gary Neville’s personal principles which aim to prepare each and every one of our students for life.
The Class of 92 are actively involved in all things UA92, so don’t be surprised if you see them around the campus.
 





“I hope UA92 makes a genuine difference and provide opportunities in life for those that otherwise would not have been given a chance to realise their potential.”
– Sir Alex Ferguson, Former Manager of Manchester United
